intro: Thea petelotii, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy red or orange flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and its trunk is often swollen at the base. It is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. Thea petelotii is also valued for its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
